title: VMware Is Ready to Rally Back to Its July Highs
text:
During Monday night's Mad Money program Jim Cramer discussed how competition is a good thing in the cloud space and the Pentagon's cloud infrastructure contract to Microsoft (MSFT) will be not only good for Microsoft, but also for a host of other cloud players, such as VMware (VMW) . Let's check out the latest charts and indicators for VMW.

In the daily bar chart of VMW, below, we can see that prices made a steep three-month correction from June to September. Prices sank from $190 to $130 before prices rebounded. VMW is now trading above the rising 50-day moving average line. Prices are below the rising 200-day moving average line but a close above $170 will change that.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line is incredibly bullish as it did not decline from June to September when prices declined. Buyers were more aggressive even as prices sank. The OBV line could soon make a new high even though VMW is well off its best levels.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is above the zero line which is bullish.

In the weekly bar chart of VMW, below, we see a positive-looking picture. Prices are still below the rising 40-week moving average line but a weekly close above $170 will change that.

The weekly OBV line shows no weakness the past year and is thus very bullish, in my opinion. The MACD oscillator just crossed to the upside for a cover shorts buy signal.

In this weekly Point and Figure chart of VMW, below, we can see an upside price target of $182 being projected.

Bottom-line strategy: I favor the upside on VMW with prices heading back up to retest its July highs for starters. Risk below $145 for now.
description: VMware Stock Is Ready to Rally Back to Its July Highs...MSFT
authors: Vmware Is Ready To Rally Back To Its July Highs
Favor The Upside On This Cloud Stock.
